file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-23-09-04 - WINDOW REVEAL ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL WINDOW REVEAL ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the window reveal assembly. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY WINDOW REVEAL ASSEMBLY - REMOV- ALL 25-23-09-000-801-A AL WINDOW REVEAL ASSEMBLY - INSTAL- ALL 25-23-09-400-801-A LATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 25-23-09 Page 1 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-23-09-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. WINDOW REVEAL ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the window reveal assembly. (2) The window reveal assembly is installed along the length of the passenger cabin, at zones 231, 232, 241, 242, 251, 252, 261, and 262. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-23-01-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-23-01-000-802-A/400 - PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE-HATCH LINING - RE- AMM TASK 25-23-03-000-801-A/400 MOVAL SRM 51-20-01 - TASK 25-23-03-000-802-A - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Spatula For cleaning available Commercially Phillips screwdriver - available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-23-09 Page 2 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Remove the window reveal assembly (AMM TASK 25-23-01-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-23-01-000-802-A/400), as applicable. (3) Remove the passenger-cabin escape-hatch lining ( AMM TASK 25-23-03-000-801-A/ 400) or (TASK 25-23-03-000-802-A), as applicable. J. Window Reveal Assembly - Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Carefully remove the shade assembly (4) from the window reveal assembly, if applicable. Refer to DET. C, Figure 401, sheet 2. (2) Remove the screws (5), washers (6) and nuts (7) to release the inner reveal frame (1), the inner reveal plate (2), and the outer reveal (3). Refer to Figure 401, sheet 2. K. Passenger-Cabin Escape-Hatch window - Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) To remove the split shade-type window reveal (8), lift and disconnect it from the lining assembly (9). Refer to Figure 401, sheet 3. (2) Remove the sealant from around the split shade-type window reveal (8) (SRM 51-20-01). Refer to Figure 401, sheet 3. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-23-09-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. WINDOW REVEAL ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the window reveal assembly. (2) The window reveal assembly is installed along the length of the passenger cabin, at zones 231, 232, 241, 242, 251, 252, 261, and 262. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-23-01-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-23-01-400-802-A/400 - PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE-HATCH LINING - IN- AMM TASK 25-23-03-400-801-A/400 STALLATION SRM 51-20-01 - TASK 25-23-03-400-802-A - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Shop wipes For cleaning AR available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) RTV 102 Sealant AR TT-I-735 Isopropyl Alcohol - commercial grade AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-23-09 Page 8 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Window Reveal Assembly - Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Do a visual inspection on the vent hole (8) located near the bottom of the inner reveal plate (2) to make sure that it is clear of debris. NOTE: The vent hole must be open to let sufficient air circulation between the plies to prevent fogging or a change in pressure during the cabin pressurization. (2) Put the inner reveal frame (1), the inner reveal plate (2), and the outer reveal (3) in position to align the holes. Refer to Figure 401, sheet 2. (3) Install the screws (6), washers (7), and nuts (8) to attach the inner reveal frame (1), the inner reveal plate (2), and the outer reveal (3). J. Passenger-Cabin Escape-Hatch Window - Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-003-A (1) NOTE: Before you install the split shade-type window reveal (8) on the lining panel (9), do these steps: • Use mild detergent and water to clean the surfaces from the inner reveal frame as necessary. • Rinse the part with a large quantity of water. • Wipe the bonding surfaces with isopropyl alcohol and a clean shop wipe. • Put solvent onto the wipe until it is soaked. (2) Apply the sealant around the flange of the split shade-type window reveal (8) (SRM 51-20-01). Refer to Figure 401, sheet 4. (3) Carefully tilt the part so that the large flange can be passed from the dÃÂ©cor side to the back side of the lining panel (9). Refer to Figure 401, sheet 4. (4) Put the split shade-type window reveal (8) and push it in position. NOTE: The RTV sealant is cured at controlled humidity. Environment must be 65ÃÂ°F plus and 35% humidity or greater for proper bonding. Additional time must be allowed for humidity/temperature. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the window reveal assembly in its original position (AMM TASK 25-23-01-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-23-01-400-802-A/400), as applicable. (2) Install the passenger-cabin escape-hatch lining in its original position ( AMM TASK 25-23-03-400-801-A/400) or (TASK 25-23-03-400-802-A), as applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-23-09 Page 9 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
